results.title: Icelandic
results.creator_credit: Icelandic Freezing Plant Corporation and Eric Johnson
results.brief_description: The frozen fish industry in Iceland. The ocean conditions that produce Iceland’s fishing grounds; the difficult ocean conditions around Iceland and the life of the fishermen; how the catch is processed; how to cook frozen fish. Also shows Iceland’s stark landscape and how her people depend upon the fishing industry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Icelandic Freezing Plant Corporation and Eric Johnson

results.title: Icebreakers
results.brief_description: This video is aimed at anyone involved with presenting at meetings, seminars, running a course or a workshop and working with small groups of people who don’t know each other that well or who don’t know each other at all. Icebreakers are fundamental in any successful delivery and this program provides a look at eight icebreakers that can be used in a variety of situations. Includes a Training Manual.

results.title: Ice society
results.creator_credit: Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Big ice: views of Antarctica”.
This series examines the great southern continent and man’s connection with it. This particular film, which is episode four, looks at the intriguing adaptations, both physical and behavioural, of plant and wildlife in the inhospitable surroundings of the Antarctic.

results.title: Ice birds
results.creator_credit: Marc Beaudet, ONF | NFB and Marc Hebert
results.brief_description: Crystal Pillar, White Lady, The Whale—these are the names given by ice-climbing enthusiasts to the spectacular ice formations surrounding Quebec’s Montmorency Falls. Ice Birds shows two experienced climbers scaling the breathtaking wall of the Crystal Pillar with precision and considerable daring, appearing from below as black spots on the vast landscape of one of nature’s masterpieces. Film without words

results.title: Ice and water: a case study
results.creator_credit: Andrew Millington, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: A case study of the ice/water system. Considers: the two properties of the ice/water system, the odd density variation with temperature and the fact that ice melts at zero degrees centigrade when subject to a high pressure. (Solids, liquids and gases series; unit 16)
results.description: A case study of the ice/water system. Considers: the two properties of the ice/water system, the odd density variation with temperature and the fact that ice melts at zero degrees centigrade when subject to a high pressure. (Solids, liquids and gases series; unit 16)

results.title: Icarus = Icare (K)
results.creator_credit: Wolf Koenig, ONF | NFB and Paul Bochner
results.brief_description: The Greek myth retold by film animation, accompanied by music for flute written by Eldon Rathburn. Music, drawing, colour and movement here follow a moving classic restraint. Daedalus, inventor of many things, provides the wings to escape from Crete but Icarus, his son, impetuously flies too high. In this film, artist and composer share equal pleasure in the telling, with a feeling the audience will share. A film without words. Award: Oberhausen
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wolf Koenig, ONF | NFB and Paul Bochner
results.description: The Greek myth retold by film animation, accompanied by music for flute written by Eldon Rathburn. Music, drawing, colour and movement here follow a moving classic restraint. results.title: Icaros
results.creator_credit: John Bird, David Atkinson and Amos Winikoff
results.brief_description: An adaptation to film of an exercise in dance and music. The animation reveals new aspects of what was an event of true improvisation. A hand drawn dance sequence which revolves around elements of the sun, light, and joy.

results.title: IC - a shrinking world
results.creator_credit: John Rimo, Bell Telephone Laboratories and Henry R. Feinberg
results.brief_description: Uses animation and color photography - much of it shot through a microscope to convey the story of integrated circuits, electronic circuits smaller than a grain of salt.
